did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: International Society for Comparative Adult Education.

did.unittitle: International Society for Comparative Adult Education (ISCAE) Records
did.abstract:
Bulk consists of correspondence related to planning of annual meetings/conferences and challenges to "growing" the organization; there is also a small amount of material relating to the book
Comparative Adult Education, published by ISCAE, and a few folders of conference material
did.langmaterial: Majority in English, a few items in German

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The International Society for Comparative Adult Education (ISCAE) is a network of adult educators whose members come from more than 30 countries. The organization has its origins in 1960 in a working group put together by Dr. Alexander N. Charters and Roby Kidd that focused on international and comparative adult education. The organization was known as the Committee for Study and Research in Comparative Adult Education (CSRCA) until 1992, when it adopted its current name.

The network has no statutes and requires no accounting or membership fees; although it does publish occasional papers the primary venue for exchange of information is the conferences held annually in various locations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p:
The
International Society for Comparative Adult Education (ISCAE) Records consist of correspondence and conference materials.

Correspondence, much of which consists of printed emails. relates almost entirely to the planning of each year's conference. Topics touched on include researchers' work, developments affecting ISCAE, and promotions and challenges the organization faced along the way. There are also address lists, participant lists, drafts of registration forms, calls for papers, occasionally drafts of papers submitted, and other similar material.

Conference material contains material actually printed and produced for a given conference. These include programs, papers, and conference proceedings. Organizations represented, other than ISCAE itself, include the Commission of Professors of Adult Education (CPAE) and UNESCO's Committee for Study and Research in Comparative Adult Education (CSRCAE).

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The bulk of the collection is correspondence, arranged in chronological order. Conference material is arranged alphabetically by the name of the sponsoring organization and then within that chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has extensive holdings related to adult education. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete list of manuscript collections, and search &summitref; for cataloged print material.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

International Society for Comparative Adult Education (ISCAE) Records,
&su_name;
